alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Northern Calcasieu; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued January 18 at 9:19PM CST until January 20 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST FRIDAY... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter to one half mile in dense fog. For the Hard Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 26 possible. * WHERE...In Louisiana, Lafayette, Upper St. Martin, Northern Calcasieu, Southern Calcasieu, Southern Jefferson Davis and Southern Acadia Parishes. In Texas, Northern Orange and Southern Orange Counties. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 4 AM CST Friday. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Lafayette; Northern Calcasieu; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; Upper St. Martin
